controls.help: Use **either** `Modifier Lines` or `Modifier Image`
controls.label: Name
controls.name: name

controls.help:
Each line of the modifier would be a separate repeatable item. These lines would be sandwiched between the RISD Weekend wordmark,

##Maximum 4 lines.

**Example:**  
      RISD  
      **Charcoal**  
      **Flashbacks**  
      Week–  
      End

“Charcoal” and “Flashbacks” would be separate items in the repeatable.
controls.label: Modifier Lines
controls.name: modifier_lines

-KKoWPZkW58hc3ibApVW__2016.description: Take in the latest student-curated show at the Gelman Student Exhibitions Gallery, an enticing space to check out new work on the second floor of the Chace Center.
-KKoWPZkW58hc3ibApVW__2016.name: Student Works @ Gelman Gallery

-KKoWcXibaWOd0BmhR-r__2016.description: Get a sense of the diverse paths alumni have taken during this panel discussion moderated by Dean of Experimental and Foundation Studies Joanne Stryker. Panelists include: Alec Babala 14 ID + Bruce Kim 13 FD of Greycork, photographer Frances Denny MFA 14 PH, Natalie Herrera 09 GD of High Gloss, and creative director Lucas Lefler BArch 12.
-KKoWcXibaWOd0BmhR-r__2016.name: Life After RISD: Alumni Panel

-KKoX5RiRURldSMXUQBO__2016.description:
President Rosanne Somerson 76 ID, the first female alum to lead the college, brings you up to date about what’s going on at RISD this year.

If you missed this event or weren’t able to see the live stream, view a video of the president’s remarks here.
-KKoX5RiRURldSMXUQBO__2016.name: President’s Update & Welcome Toast

-KKoXR8ePLKXy58oNjLv__2016.description: Tavares Strachan 03 GL delivers the keynote lecture for RISD Weekend, which also marks the launch of RISD Glass’ 50th year celebration. Strachan caught the attention of the international art scene in 2006 when he embarked on a journey to the Alaskan Arctic to excavate a 4.5 ton block of ice which he then transported via FedEx to his native Bahamas and displayed in a solar-powered freezer. He has exhibited internationally at venues such as the Venice Biennale, MIT List Art Gallery, The Brooklyn Museum and Ron Feldman Fine Art, New York. His work and process exemplifies the dedication to skill, risk taking and innovation has defined RISD Glass and made it a leader in its field from its inception.
-KKoXR8ePLKXy58oNjLv__2016.name: Alumni Keynote | Tavares Strachan 03 GL

-KKoXcanuO0652InWSz6__2016.description: Mix and mingle while enjoying cocktails and live music in the RISD Museum’s atmospheric Main Gallery.
-KKoXcanuO0652InWSz6__2016.name: Art After Dark

-KKsKr5z3AOWhKbA6JEX__2016.description: Both little and larger hands can engage in some big art making together on the RISD Beach. Explore weaving, sewing, mending and embroidery with Laura Evonne Steinman 99 SC of Hand in Hand Arts. Everyone welcome, from those who have never touched fabric before to textiles professionals.
-KKsKr5z3AOWhKbA6JEX__2016.name: Hands-on All Ages Workshop | Fall Fabric Fun

-KKsL5vhxKGqlbsf0_SN__2016.description: The camera obscura returns with a brand-new design. Creators Peter Goldberg 87 PH and Erik Gould have collaborated with RISD alumni at Pnuehaus to create an all-new inflatable camera obscura. Come and see what it feels like to step inside a giant eyeball, experiencing the phenomenon of light that is the basis of vision, photography, video and movies.
-KKsL5vhxKGqlbsf0_SN__2016.name: Colossal Camera Curiosity

-KKsLVdtwXKohplN3SqS__2016.description: Whether you’re browsing, buying or doing a bit of both, you’ll discover great work created by more than 120 alumni and student artists in this juried sale. Be sure to cast your vote for the People's Choice award.
-KKsLVdtwXKohplN3SqS__2016.location_details: Benefit Street between Waterman & Hopkins streets
-KKsLVdtwXKohplN3SqS__2016.name: RISD Craft - Outdoor Juried Art Sale

-KKsLmlo-FB0U6odMNM7__2016.description: Browse through a fascinating selection of used books and prints on display in front of 15 West (or inside the RISD library, if the weather doesn’t cooperate). Proceeds from the sale support the acquisition of new items for the library’s collection.
-KKsLmlo-FB0U6odMNM7__2016.name: Books + Prints Sale

-KKsLzhmwp7sUowXm5tN__2016.description: Learn about the surprising range of options available in creative fields and the resources the Career Center offers students and alumni.
-KKsLzhmwp7sUowXm5tN__2016.name: Career Options in Art and Design

-KKsMEdvPedeSHJL8p1C__2016.description: RISD archivist Andy Martinez introduces the college’s rich history via a leisurely walk around campus that highlights the changing landscape and diverse architectural structures.
-KKsMEdvPedeSHJL8p1C__2016.name: Walking Tour of Historic RISD

-KKsMXZcgsgvbIMD9vO4__2016.description: Get a feel for what it’s like to be immersed in intense, full-day studios in this intro to and Q&A about RISD’s Experimental and Foundation Studies program led by Dean of Experimental and Foundation Studies Joanne Stryker.
-KKsMXZcgsgvbIMD9vO4__2016.name: The First-Year Experience

-KKsXul7S_L84hMf4yz6__2016.description:
$30 for lunch / registration required

Members of the classes of 1971 and 1966 (celebrating their 45th and 50th reunions) and all earlier graduation years are invited to this special luncheon with President Rosanne Somerson.
-KKsXul7S_L84hMf4yz6__2016.name: Half-Century Celebration: Classes of 1971, 1966 + all earlier years

-KKsYHmg1ulE9o6bvihG__2016.description: An opportunity for alumni to revisit their departments and for parents to discover the allure of various studio majors. Students will greet you outside to guide you into the studio spaces, answer questions and talk about their departments. More information about specific departmental exhibitions, hands-on demonstrations and lectures will be available at registration.
-KKsYHmg1ulE9o6bvihG__2016.name: Open Studios

sub_events.description: Come visit 189 Canal Street, home to the Apparel Design majors. The building was recently renovated to accommodate the technical and creative demands of the undergraduate fashion studies. Check out recent work by current students and faculty members on view throughout the building and watch spring Collection fashion shows on screens stationed on the first floor.
sub_events.subtitle: Apparel Design
sub_events.title: Apparel Design

sub_events.description: Visit 5x5: Participatory Provocations, on display in the first floor BEB Gallery. The exhibition features architectural models by 25 young American architects and presents responses to five contemporary issues from five architectural firms. Students will be working in studio and available to answer questions. Student work will be exhibited in Pop Up Pin Up (Room 106, adjacent to the gallery).
sub_events.subtitle: Architecture
sub_events.title: Architecture

sub_events.description: Watch Ceramics students throwing pots, hand-building projects and glazing, and examine completed work on display in the Installation Room and display cabinet. Head to Providence’s Steelyard at 27 Sims Avenue to see a custom-built anagrama wood kiln in action.
sub_events.subtitle: Ceramics
sub_events.title: Ceramics

sub_events.description: Join current FAV students for a look at the inner workings of the department. They will be showing some incredible work and explaining how they made it happen.
sub_events.location_details: Entrance on Market Square doors near North Main Street
sub_events.subtitle: Film/Animation/Video
sub_events.title: F/A/V

sub_events.description: Students will be working and available to answer questions in the Wood Shop and Metal Shop and in studio spaces in the Bank Building and Prov-Wash (20 Washington Place). Joanna Moller MFA 18 FD will demonstrate bentwood lamination in the Wood Shop, and a variety of demos will be held in the Bank Building: CNC production of chair forms by David Riley 17 FD and Lu Xu MFA 17 FD and Rapid Prototype Printing and Laser Cutting by Cecilia Plasencia MFA 18 FD.
sub_events.location_details: Wood Shop, first floor / Metal Shop, basement + 20 Washington Place, 2nd floor + Bank Building, 28 Market Square
sub_events.subtitle: Furniture Design
sub_events.title: Furniture Design

sub_events.description: Help kick off our yearlong celebration of 50 Years of Glass. Come to the Hot Shop from 12–2 to see students blowing glass and answering questions about the process. Join us at 2 pm in the Metcalf Auditorium (Chace Center, first floor), where distinguished alumni Jamie Carpenter 72 IL, Toots Zynsky 73 GL, Helen Lee MFA 06 GL and Alex Rosenberg 06 GL will discuss their work and the very different career paths they have taken since their time in RISD Glass. At 4 pm MASS MoCA Curator Denise Markonish will chat with will lead a discussion with Department Head Rachel Berwick 84 GL, faculty Jocelyne Prince MFA 94 GL, Bruce Chao 73 SC/MFA 75 GL and alum Tavares Strachan 03 GL about the dynamic environment of experimentation and investigation of both the material and conceptual manifestations of Glass at RISD and the different ways in which RISD Glass and its alumni are shaping the contemporary art world.. And don’t forget to visit the Graduate Glass Biennial Quinquagenary at Sol Koffler Gallery (12–6 pm, CIT, 126 Weybosset Street).
sub_events.subtitle: Glass
sub_events.title: Glass

sub_events.description: Visit the third-floor Type Shop to enjoy refreshments, bind a book using the new bookbinding machine and make prints on the letterpress with a senior Graphic Design student. Check out the Design Center display cases and a newly hung exhibition of sophomore work in the Commons Gallery (both on the first floor).
sub_events.subtitle: Graphic Design
sub_events.title: Graphic Design

sub_events.description:
Visit The Narrative Image, an exhibition in the ISB Gallery featuring work by acclaimed designer Melinda Beck 89 GD and celebrated illustrator Julia Rothman 02 IL, who will present a gallery talk together at noon. At 2 pm, alumni Juana Medina 10 GD, Salley Mavor 78 IL and Stuart Murphy 64 IL will read from their children’s books

in the ISB Gallery and discuss their work. Senior Illustration students will be on hand in the second- and third- floor home spaces all afternoon to talk about their work and experiences in the Illustration department.
sub_events.subtitle: Illustration
sub_events.title: Illustration

sub_events.description: The Industrial Design department is celebrating the unique vision of late professor Marc Harrison with a silk-screening party featuring his iconic anvil and butterfly image. Bring a shirt or grab one onsite and be prepared to get your hands dirty. Metal Shop Technician Will Reeves will lead the workshop in the ID parking lot.
sub_events.subtitle: Industrial Design
sub_events.title: ID

sub_events.description: Check out student work in progress as well as finished jewelry in exhibition cases. A looping PowerPoint presentation in Room 216 will demonstrate how objects are created using CAD technology.
sub_events.subtitle: Jewelry + Metalsmithing
sub_events.title: J+M

sub_events.description: Work by Painting students is on view in the Woods-Gerry Gallery (10 am–5 pm, 62 Prospect Street) and the Memorial Hall Gallery (10–4 pm, 3rd floor, Memorial Hall). Plein Air and More: Sophomore Painting-a-Day in the Memorial Hall lobby showcases a selection of sophomore work based on a typical second-year assignment and features three vertically hung pieces by each sophomore in the department. Students will also be working in studio throughout the building.
sub_events.subtitle: Painting
sub_events.title: Painting

sub_events.description: Department Head Steve Smith, faculty member Curran Broderick and a cadre of student helpers will operate a Tintype Photo Portrait Studio from 11 am–3 pm. Visitors will be able to pose for photos, watch as a photo plate is sensitized and loaded into the camera and then, moments later, view the plate as it is quickly developed into a finished, antique-style tintype portrait. The portraits are free, and faculty and students will be on hand to answer questions about RISD’s Photography program.
sub_events.subtitle: Photography
sub_events.title: Photo

sub_events.description: Interested in learning how to apply silkscreen printing to a tote bag? Starting at 1pm, check out a student-run demonstration on the third floor. Students will also be working in studios throughout the building and answering questions about the Printmaking department.
sub_events.subtitle: Printmaking
sub_events.title: Printmaking

sub_events.description: Adjunct faculty member Samantha Pasapane MFA 14 SC leads an Exquisite Corpse project with Sculpture students. Based on the French Surrealist game, it involves people making their own small sculptures that are then incorporated into a single, larger piece. Visitors are welcome to don welding helmets and watch and to participate in a separate version of the project involving drawing.
sub_events.subtitle: Sculpture
sub_events.title: Sculpture

sub_events.description: Watch RISD’s impressive electronic jacquard loom in action, right across from the Chace Center entrance from 11 am–1 pm. Technical Assistant Polly Spenner 10 TX will be on hand to answer questions, and current students will lead departmental tours in College Building, showcasing the weaving, knit and print studios.
sub_events.location_details: Metcalf Building + College Building, Rooms 446 and 542
sub_events.subtitle: Textiles
sub_events.title: Textiles

-KKsYVNdtBAPTOMa35wG__2016.description: This session led by RISD’s Student Affairs staff offers parents insights and ideas for supporting student artists and designers from a distance. Learn about the benefits of extracurricular activities and the importance of wellness and balance in navigating the RISD experience.
-KKsYVNdtBAPTOMa35wG__2016.name: Healthy Living at RISD

-KKsYlZEtIaSXjUj8jOs__2016.description: The RISD Museum was recently named one of the 20 Must-See Art Museums in America by Fodor’s Travel. Get a feel for the museum’s remarkable body of more than 92,000 works of art from all periods and genres. A docent will guide you through an exhibition featuring some of the most notable pieces in the collection.
-KKsYlZEtIaSXjUj8jOs__2016.name: Greatest Hits @ the RISD Museum

sub_events.location_details: meet at sign in the Chace Center lobby

-KKsh3Kec9v6b9hTAOuD__2016.description: Readers, writers and illustrators of all ages are invited to join award-winning children’s book creators Stuart Murphy 64 IL, Juana Medina 10 GD and Salley Mavor 78 IL as they read aloud from their picture books. A book signing sponsored by risd | works will follow.
-KKsh3Kec9v6b9hTAOuD__2016.name: RISD READS | Children’s Book Reading and Signing

-KKshOhBSp8bxRjQGYZI__2016.description: Distinguished alumni James Carpenter 72 IL, Toots Zynsky 73 GL, Helen Lee MFA 06 GL and Alex Rosenberg 06 GL will discuss their work and the very different career paths they have taken since their time in RISD Glass, providing insight into the Glass department’s approach to developing artistic perspectives through disciplined investigations, experimentation and rigorous material inquiry.
-KKshOhBSp8bxRjQGYZI__2016.name: 50 Years of Glass: Material Investigations

-KKshXNYepHyfCOo0kje__2016.description: Denise Markonish, Curator, Mass MoCA, will lead a discussion with Department Head Rachel Berwick 84 GL, faculty Jocelyne Prince MFA 94 GL, Bruce Chao 73 SC/MFA 75 GL and alum Tavares Strachan 03 GL about the dynamic environment of experimentation and investigation of both the material and conceptual manifestations of Glass at RISD and the different ways in which RISD Glass and its alumni are shaping the contemporary art world.
-KKshXNYepHyfCOo0kje__2016.name: 50 Years of Glass: Panel Discussion

-KKsjLVNi2LJZzAvTFLz__2016.description:
$65 per person | registration required | limited cash bar*

Classes celebrating reunions dine together this evening at the following times and locations. One drink tickets are included for the cocktail hour that precedes dinner.
-KKsjLVNi2LJZzAvTFLz__2016.name: Reunion Dinners

-KKsjxgnkunkDJDiyKQv__2016.name: Greatest Hits @ the RISD Museum - Day 2

-KKsk9h_x15vH_wbEVCb__2016.description: Visit the RISD Career Center at 123 Dyer Street, where staff will be on hand to show you around and introduce major resources for students and alumni: ArtWorks, RISD Portfolios, LinkedIn, career programs and signature events.
-KKsk9h_x15vH_wbEVCb__2016.name: Career Center Open House

-KKskT5sicTFSBYiwiX4__2016.description:
$40 per person Early Bird Special - UNTIL SEPTEMBER 26** | registration required

Make goodbye a little easier over mimosas and brunch in the RISD Museum. Brunch will be followed by a private tour of the museum’s Prints, Drawings and Photographs collection at 11:30 with Curator Jan Howard. Take this last opportunity to connect, reminisce and perhaps begin planning your next reunion.


**$50 per person from September 26 - October 3Chace
-KKskT5sicTFSBYiwiX4__2016.name: Class of 1966: 50th Reunion Brunch

-KKskf3yGXlqybARtkWZ__2016.description: Tour campus spaces, examine exciting new work and chat with some of the artists and organizers as part of our guided gallery tour. You’ll begin at Woods-Gerry Gallery, where Campus Exhibitions Director Mark Moscone 88 PR will discuss the exhibition on display. From there, the group will move to two other campus galleries, Gelman (located within the museum) and Sol Koffler, which features graduate-level work.
-KKskf3yGXlqybARtkWZ__2016.name: On-campus Exhibitions Tour

-KKySF8tV5uhaU0g_QHW__2016.description: Everyone enjoys a day at the beach, but this workshop with Nature Lab Director Neal Overstrom provides a true sense of Rhode Island as the Ocean State, reflecting on the processes that sustain life in our coastal marine communities. Using Nature Lab imaging equipment ranging from microscopes to ecosystem-level geographic information systems, we’ll examine the tiny organisms that live in Narragansett Bay and discover why they are critical to the health of the ocean and the human race.
-KKySF8tV5uhaU0g_QHW__2016.name: Exploring the Scalable World
-KKySF8tV5uhaU0g_QHW__2016.subtitle: with Neal Overstrom

-KKyclvTQaaE-GEy94mp__2016.description: In this interactive session with Lane Myer, a senior critic in the Sculpture department, participants will gain a deeper understanding of the mind’s agility and how it can both help and hinder creativity and understanding.
-KKyclvTQaaE-GEy94mp__2016.name: Mind Games
-KKyclvTQaaE-GEy94mp__2016.subtitle: with Lane Myer

-KKycxbzGs63YriQoR0N__2016.description: Participants will get an in-depth look at what really happens during critique sessions at RISD, looking, listening and reflecting deeply on the work in question, with Illustration Professor Fred Lynch 86 IL.
-KKycxbzGs63YriQoR0N__2016.name: The Crit - Session 1
-KKycxbzGs63YriQoR0N__2016.subtitle: with Fred Lynch

-KKyd48wjaLMXtNMfx3-__2016.description: Special Collections Librarian Claudia Covert and her colleague Ariel Bordeaux invite participants to explore the history of the pop-up book from the 1700s to the present. Using both mass-produced and hand-crafted books as inspiration, participants will implement what they learn and make their own pop-up books.
-KKyd48wjaLMXtNMfx3-__2016.name: Pop-up Books
-KKyd48wjaLMXtNMfx3-__2016.subtitle: with Claudia Covert and Ariel Bordeaux

-KKydBgqOr4iE9lCFIau__2016.description: The Fleet Library’s Material Resource Center houses one of the nation’s largest material samples collections. Students and faculty engage the collection for inspiration and research, to source materials and better understand their properties and processes. Join librarian Mark Pompelia for a special inside look at this invaluable collection.
-KKydBgqOr4iE9lCFIau__2016.name: RISD’s Material Resource Center
-KKydBgqOr4iE9lCFIau__2016.subtitle: with Mark Pompelia

-KKydWbLBLy2_45-4c44__2016.description: Look closely at a selected work in this guided introductory session. Context and connections are illuminated through lively conversation facilitated by a RISD Museum educator. Please enter through the 224 Benefit Street entrance.
-KKydWbLBLy2_45-4c44__2016.name: Ways of Looking - Session 2
-KKydWbLBLy2_45-4c44__2016.subtitle: with a RISD Museum educator

-KKz5KeOm2nmdvszihmS__2016.description:
$55 per person Early Bird Special - UNTIL SEPTEMBER 26** | registration required | limited cash bar

Catch up over dinner with classmates celebrating their 50th reunion. One drink ticket is included for the cocktail hour that precedes dinner.


** $65 per person from September 26 - October 3
-KKz5KeOm2nmdvszihmS__2016.name: Class of 1966: 50th Reunion Dinner

-KKz5TXAnEwLpOFSLRU7__2016.description:
$55 per person - UNTIL SEPTEMBER 26** | registration required | limited cash bar

Catch up over dinner with classmates celebrating their 40th reunion. One drink ticket is included for the cocktail hour that precedes dinner.


**$65 per person from September 26 - October 3
-KKz5TXAnEwLpOFSLRU7__2016.name: Class of 1976: 40th Reunion Dinner

-KKz5aYzVujSX91716up__2016.description:
$55 per person Early Bird Special - UNTIL SEPTEMBER 26** | registration required | limited cash bar

Classes celebrating reunions catch up over dinner at various locations. One drink ticket is included for the cocktail hour that precedes dinner.


$65 per person from September 26 - October 3
-KKz5aYzVujSX91716up__2016.name: Classes of 1981 (35th) & 1971 (45th) Reunion Dinners

-KKz5k0iIpLpZJvpnsFm__2016.description:
$35 per person Early Bird Special - UNTIL SEPTEMBER 26** | registration required | limited cash bar

The Class of 1986 celebrates its 30th reunion over cocktails and savory edibles at the Woods-Gerry Gallery. Includes appetizers from Mijos food truck and Tricycle ice cream sandwiches. One drink ticket is included.


**$45 per person from September 26 - October 3
-KKz5k0iIpLpZJvpnsFm__2016.name: Class of 1986 (30th) Reunion Dinner Reception

-KKz5sGyi7mKsew6_jpj__2016.description:
$35 per person Early Bird Special - UNTIL SEPTEMBER 26** | registration required | limited cash bar

The Class of 1991 celebrates its 25th reunion over cocktails and sumptuous, all-you-care-to-eat heavy hors d’oeuvres in the gorgeous Fleet Library. One drink ticket is included.


$45 per person from September 26 - October 3
-KKz5sGyi7mKsew6_jpj__2016.name: Class of 1991: 25th Reunion Dinner Reception

-KKz67Ns6j-k5RmxGnpe__2016.description:
$55 per person Early Bird Special - UNTIL SEPTEMBER 26**| registration required | limited cash bar

Classes celebrating reunions catch up over dinner at various locations. One drink ticket is included for the cocktail hour that precedes dinner.


**$65 per person from September 26 - October 3
-KKz67Ns6j-k5RmxGnpe__2016.name: Classes of 2011 (5th), 2006 (10th), 2001 (15th), 1996 (20th) Reunion Dinner

-KLMGrTFXwMDxtIKGMBm.description: Participants will get an in-depth look at what really happens during critique sessions at RISD, looking, listening and reflecting deeply on the work in question. The session will be led by Experimental and Foundation Studies Professor Todd Moore MFA 84 PT.
-KLMGrTFXwMDxtIKGMBm.name: The Crit - Session 2
-KLMGrTFXwMDxtIKGMBm.subtitle: with Todd Moore

-KLMIbDa6fVIiDEQTvm_.description: Strike a pose on RISD’s famed beach while your visage is immortalized in caricature by RISD’s own Phil Oliveira 16 CE. Great fun and free!
-KLMIbDa6fVIiDEQTvm_.name: Caricatures on RISD Beach

-KMUmWhj71FOhgJUQTUM.description: Join RISD Glass alumni, students, faculty and friends as we launch a year-long celebration of 50 Years of RISD Glass.
-KMUmWhj71FOhgJUQTUM.name: 50 Years of Glass: Cocktail Reception and Book Preview

-KMiu6wEVndM3sS27cb0.description: Participants will get an insider’s look at different formats of the crit in RISD studio classes with ample opportunity to ask questions and discuss these essential interactions. Our conversation will touch on the fears, realities, objectives and cautions that surround the critique to uncover the importance of this vital element of the RISD education.
-KMiu6wEVndM3sS27cb0.name: The Studio Class Crit
-KMiu6wEVndM3sS27cb0.subtitle: with Ken Takashi Horii

-KQ6hbQY1l20NMOmkrnh.description: In this unique live-projection performance, New York artists Sandra Gibson 99 FAV and Luis Recoder explore the optical properties of glass (using pieces made for the event by RISD students) to create what they describe as “an encounter with projective fractography.” The artists use celluloid, crystals and hand gestures to bend, reflect, refract or otherwise manipulate light beams generated by 35mm film projectors.
-KQ6hbQY1l20NMOmkrnh.location_details: Across from RISD Museum on North Main Street
-KQ6hbQY1l20NMOmkrnh.name: 50 Years of Glass: Glass Menagerie
-KQ6hbQY1l20NMOmkrnh.subtitle: A Projection Performance by Gibson + Recoder

-KRe899FH0M900e-0zA2.description: Central to RISD’s mission is our commitment to global learning and engagement, which the college realizes through a series of on- and off-campus programs, partnerships, initiatives and curricula. We welcome you to visit RISD Global and learn more about how RISD explores the many ways that art and design intersect with globalization and influence schools of thought around the world.
-KRe899FH0M900e-0zA2.name: Why RISD Global?

-KS3Auo8m8bkIWNRpIRT.description: Look closely at a selected work in this guided introductory session. Context and connections are illuminated through lively conversation facilitated by a RISD Museum educator. Please enter through the 224 Benefit Street entrance.
-KS3Auo8m8bkIWNRpIRT.name: Ways of Looking - Session 1

-KS7auuqciBm4xvsTV69.description: Remember what it was like to search for images before the Internet? Visit the Fleet Library’s collection of over 500,000 images arranged by subject and find out how RISD students continue to use this valuable resource in the digital age.
-KS7auuqciBm4xvsTV69.name: The RISD Library Picture Collection

-KSIiIaXCvFs8U74THVn.description: A figure drawing session for the reunion class of 1986 led by RISD faculty Joanne Stryker.
-KSIiIaXCvFs8U74THVn.name: Class of 1986 Drawing Session

-KSNaQ55ldCvDVTpPcuH.description: Illustrators Melinda Beck 89 GD and Julia Rothman 02 IL discuss The Narrative Image, a new exhibition on view at the ISB Gallery. The show runs through November 5, and the gallery is open Wednesday through Saturday from 12–5 pm (and open late on Waterfire nights).
-KSNaQ55ldCvDVTpPcuH.name: The Narrative Image
-KSNaQ55ldCvDVTpPcuH.subtitle: with Melinda Beck and Julia Rothman

-KSNlscdY4GsdRwBNNbB.description: In this interactive session with Lane Myer, a senior critic in the Sculpture department, participants will gain a deeper understanding of the mind’s agility and how it can both help and hinder creativity and understanding.
-KSNlscdY4GsdRwBNNbB.name: Mind Games - Session 2
-KSNlscdY4GsdRwBNNbB.subtitle: with Lane Myer

-KSbw1lQ49HIz3V-Aurw.description: Come hang out with friends old and new. No need to reserve a space in advance.
-KSbw1lQ49HIz3V-Aurw.name: Class of 1986 Drop-in Brunch

-KSbxQ1NROnSv5xDdhJf.description: Come hang out with friends old and new. No need to reserve a space in advance.
-KSbxQ1NROnSv5xDdhJf.name: Class of 1986 Drop-in Brunch II

-KSbyNdoLlYl6Ln4NbXn.description: A current RISD student will walk you through campus, pointing out new buildings as well as old favorites.
-KSbyNdoLlYl6Ln4NbXn.name: Class of 1986 Campus Tour

-KSc0kCoHcrtFqLRqL-9.description: Come party until the wee hours with the Class of 1991. Small cover charge at the door.
-KSc0kCoHcrtFqLRqL-9.name: Class of 1991 After Party

-KSc1_8_x59QQhYQgwR1.description: It’s a 1991 potluck cookout at the Farm!
-KSc1_8_x59QQhYQgwR1.name: Class of 1991 Cookout

-KScb2_x9k7cka-LwKog.description: Get pretty as a picture and make memories during this free opportunity to take old-school photo strips with family and friends!.
-KScb2_x9k7cka-LwKog.name: Assemble Your Squad
-KScb2_x9k7cka-LwKog.subtitle: Photo Booth at RISD Weekend

-KSx0zaUABG0oExj2Mbc.description: Watch America's favorite college club basketball team challenge its distinguished alumni players.
-KSx0zaUABG0oExj2Mbc.name: RISD Balls vs. Balls Alumni Basketball Game

-LFrytznDQys26z62wJo.description: Participants will get an in-depth look at what really happens during critique sessions at RISD: looking at the work in question, reflecting deeply, discussing specific strengths and possible improvements and suggesting additional possibilities. Led by Professor of Experimental and Foundation Studies Ken Horii.
-LFrytznDQys26z62wJo.name: RISD Revealed | The Crit

-LFs-h6PVZlq8Vys9kAd.description: President Somerson provides an update on new initiatives and recent renovations, including major updates to the College Building and the ongoing Quad project. She’ll also respond to alumni concerns expressed in last year’s comprehensive survey.
-LFs-h6PVZlq8Vys9kAd.name: Welcome & Update from the President

-LFs0eG_Y7llzqJs6MmF.description: You’re invited to learn what it would feel like to step inside a giant eyeball. Creators Peter Goldberg 87 PH and Erik Gould have collaborated with RISD alumni at Pnuehaus design collective to create an all-new inflatable camera obscura.
-LFs0eG_Y7llzqJs6MmF.name: Colossal Camera Curiosity

-LFs16SJ_WL136obEfuc.description: Peruse the bountiful array of fine art, handmade crafts and exemplary design by more than 130 alumni and student artists during this juried retail sale on Benefit Street. Engage with makers while finding that unique gift, check out our jurors' pick for Best Emerging Artist and cast your vote for the People’s Choice award.
-LFs16SJ_WL136obEfuc.location_details: outdoors on Benefit Street (between Waterman & Hopkins streets)
-LFs16SJ_WL136obEfuc.name: RISD Craft | Alumni & Student Art Sale

-LFs1Jcgf7qJnJ2_BTo_.description: Meet Center for Student Involvement (CSI) staff and participating students, who will describe on- and off-campus RISD programs centered on ideas of awareness, collaboration, action, learning and development such as the Pre-Orientation Service Experience (POSE), Alternative Spring Break, MLK Day of Service and the Leadership and Community Engagement Program (LACE).
-LFs1Jcgf7qJnJ2_BTo_.name: Parent Pick | Student Life at RISD

-LFs1XW_ws2dKlMANRX-.description: RISD archivist Andy Martinez reflects on the college’s rich history via a leisurely walk around campus that highlights the changing landscape and diverse architectural structures.
-LFs1XW_ws2dKlMANRX-.location_details: departs from the front entrance of the Mandle Building
-LFs1XW_ws2dKlMANRX-.name: Walking Tour of Historic RISD

-LFs1y8xJvyQ40AGejUg.description: RISD Career Center Director Kevin Jankowski 88 IL discusses the range of opportunities in creative job markets and resources available to RISD students.
-LFs1y8xJvyQ40AGejUg.name: Parent Pick | Career Options in Art & Design

-LFs2SjjNXy6GNJOah8k.description: Staff will be on hand to lead brief tours of the Career Center’s new home and to share information about resources for students.
-LFs2SjjNXy6GNJOah8k.name: Career Center Open House

-LFs2cMUpQp0dz2WOv4y.description: Grab a bite from a local food truck and connect with friends under the tent. We’ll provide the drinks and cookies as well as lively entertainment by the RISD/Brown taiko drummers.
-LFs2cMUpQp0dz2WOv4y.name: Lunch on the Square

-LFs2uADZg8Sw3GAWWAc.description: Join us for lunch at the Providence Art Club to celebrate 45th, 50th, 55th, 60th and 65th reunions (and all earlier years). Come prepared to share old memories and make new ones.
-LFs2uADZg8Sw3GAWWAc.name: Half-Century Luncheon | Classes of 1974, ’69, ’64, ’59 & all earlier years
-LFs2uADZg8Sw3GAWWAc.subtitle: $35 for lunch

-LFs3ZCaatj_gjslLjuf.description: People of all ages are invited to drop in to design and create monster bookmarks out of fabric and yarn. Led by Laura Evonne Steinman 99 SC of Hand in Hand Arts.
-LFs3ZCaatj_gjslLjuf.name: Weekend Workshop | Family Fun

-LFs3prDRdNWDHmMxsAM.description: This campus tour will focus on newly renovated spaces that many returning alumni have not seen before.
-LFs3prDRdNWDHmMxsAM.name: Campus Tour | 21st-Century RISD

-LFs4SLn8bLDBuI3Sqe3.description: Immerse yourself in the WaterFire experience along RISD’s riverfront, with wine, light snacks, music in Market Square and fun with the incredible BIG NAZO Mobile Creature Unit designed by Erminio Pinque 83 IL.
-LFs4SLn8bLDBuI3Sqe3.name: WaterFire Reception

-LFs4tIpNvQYOfnB56Wh.description: Alumni who graduated in 1959, ’69, ’74, ’79, ’84, ’89, ’94, ’99, '04 and '09 catch up with members of their class over dinner. See registration page for detailed pricing.
-LFs4tIpNvQYOfnB56Wh.name: Reunion Dinners
-LFs4tIpNvQYOfnB56Wh.subtitle: $55-90 per person | limited cash bar

-LFs5QFKnN2YFEF4ihRs.description: Take advantage of one more opportunity to spend time with friends old and new before hitting the road. Music provided by local jazz musician Preston McClanahan (Professor Emeritus, Graphic Design) and his group Echoes of New Orleans.
-LFs5QFKnN2YFEF4ihRs.name: Jazz Brunch at The Met

-LGkXmHLvXI8BsiCmH9s.description: Teenagers (13–17) are invited to explore digital portrait photography. They’ll take turns acting as photographer and model as they learn the fundamentals of studio lighting, shooting and processing using Adobe Photoshop. Cameras will be provided for those who need them and participants can take home their portraits.
-LGkXmHLvXI8BsiCmH9s.name: Weekend Workshop | Photography for Teens

-LgTPW7t3n61DdJastc9.description: Industrial Design faculty member Bill Foulkes presents a special session for entrepreneurial artists and designers. Learn about the issues shaping today’s commercial landscape and how you can overcome challenges and nurture your idea for a creative business venture.
-LgTPW7t3n61DdJastc9.name: Alumni Pick | How’s Business?

-LgTPiHcETi0zhyIx3l6.name: Student Exhibition | Work from the Class of 2019

-LgTQfmQM084dPi6lVPd.description: Each year approximately 350 RISD students and faculty members participate in off-campus global learning experiences custom-created to meet the goals of art and design practitioners preparing to contribute to a global society. Meet the team that coordinates these experiences and see how global learning influences student perspectives long after college.
-LgTQfmQM084dPi6lVPd.name: RISD Global | Art & Design Programs in an Age of Globalization

-LgTROh_sakvqn_hOQFz.description: Industrial Design faculty member Bill Foulkes presents a special session for entrepreneurial artists and designers. Learn about the issues shaping today’s commercial landscape and how you can overcome challenges and nurture your idea for a creative business venture.
-LgTROh_sakvqn_hOQFz.name: Alumni Pick | How’s Business?

-LgTRhDpDMkHQm7E6Kep.description: The RISD Alumni Association recognizes the accomplishments of some of our most inspirational alumni. Congratulate the awardees, connect with friends and plan your weekend activities at the reception.
-LgTRhDpDMkHQm7E6Kep.name: Alumni Awards & Reception

-LgTS1tkCCj-6lBRTFSk.description: Families of current students are welcomed to campus by RISD’s new provost, Kent Kleinman.
-LgTS1tkCCj-6lBRTFSk.name: Provost’s Welcome & Reception

-LgTTJ6cCBSXYa7KuzYe.description: Enjoy a cash bar and ’90s dance music as you reconnect with members of the Class of 1994.
-LgTTJ6cCBSXYa7KuzYe.name: Class of 1994 | ’90s Dance Party

-LgTUMryMcnt-vScWiR4.description: Please join us for a panel discussion highlighting the many ways alumni makers and designers are using the skills they honed at RISD to make a positive impact on the world. RISD Trustee and Airbnb cofounder Joe Gebbia 05 GD/ID hosts a panel of global influencers that includes Karam Foundation CEO Lina Sergie Attar March 01, local anti-gun activist Scott Lapham 90 PH and Brooklyn-based cofounder of Morcos Key design studio Jon Key 13 GD.
-LgTUMryMcnt-vScWiR4.name: Panel Discussion | Alumni Impact

-LgTVQcf6wHWKkw9klhg.description: Finance expert and best-selling author Beth Kobliner offers advice for students and parents about navigating finances, making smart decisions and setting up a successful post-college financial life.
-LgTVQcf6wHWKkw9klhg.name: Parent Pick | Financial Advice for Students

-LgTVySR_TT9hCDs-qNn.description: The Illustration department is proud to present the work of influential NYC art director SooJin Buzelli 96 IL and her partner, sought-after artist Chris Buzelli 95 IL, known for his sumptuous illustrations in oil. They’ll share their work and discuss how they collaboratively shape visual content involving text and images.
-LgTVySR_TT9hCDs-qNn.name: Visiting Artists | Buzellis Talk Shop

-LgTWsddNPKq2agz6lQW.description: In this drawing workshop, students aged 13–17 learn the basics of cartoon anatomy and character design. They’ll experiment with tools and materials as they create original and memorable characters.
-LgTWsddNPKq2agz6lQW.name: Weekend Workshop | Cartoon Anatomy for Teens

-LgTXVeszh4AyaCv2bDV.attendee_limit: space is limited; first come, first served
-LgTXVeszh4AyaCv2bDV.description: Alumni are invited back into the studio for a series of workshops: figure drawing with Professor Victor Lara, drawing in the style of Edna Lawrence with Nature Lab Coordinator Betsy Ruppa, tiny-town sketching with Professor Mark Milloff and more.
-LgTXVeszh4AyaCv2bDV.name: Weekend Workshop | Foundation Redux

-LgTYjTQT63XIMq_3xLr.name: Alumni Association Meeting (open to all alumni)

-LgZ6ltbraDRYv7-DJgF.description: RISD Museum fellow Tayana Fincher leads an informal workshop in the European galleries exploring different historical perspectives and considering themes of silenced and multiple narratives through the study of Iberian silk fragments from the Costume & Textiles collection.
-LgZ6ltbraDRYv7-DJgF.name: RISD Museum | Viewpoints 1491

-LgZ8YfSNzQJ03ESVaXo.description: Look closely at a selected work in this guided introductory session. Context and connections are illuminated through lively conversation facilitated by a RISD Museum educator. Meet in Chace Center lobby.
-LgZ8YfSNzQJ03ESVaXo.name: RISD Museum | Ways of Looking

-LgZ8mMkqBVJn72ZI4W6.description: Join this docent-led tour of the RISD Museum collection.
-LgZ8mMkqBVJn72ZI4W6.name: RISD Museum | Collection Highlights

-Lhg82Z3AiRg-rk9FUNs.description: Looking for a little fun in the sun? Stop by the RISD Beach and bring the kids! Ricky Rainbow Beard (aka RISD alum and AS220 Black Box Theater regular Ricky Katowicz 05 AP) will be helping visitors of all ages make surprisingly silly crafts and putting on mini-puppet shows throughout the day!
-Lhg82Z3AiRg-rk9FUNs.name: Weekend Workshop | Ricky Rainbow Beard on the Beach

-KTLxjzMcEX3N58bj_7g.address: Bayard Ewing Building, 231 South Main Street
-KTLxjzMcEX3N58bj_7g.name: BEB

-KMu__0g-I3c8iV6Pk7T.main_description:
RISD is located just off of I-95 and I-195 on the East Side of Providence in the College Hill neighborhood, at 2 College Street, Providence, RI 02903.

Parking (metered or timed) is available along Benefit Street, North Main Street/South Main Street, or at various Metropark locations nearby. All RISD parking lots will be open but have limited availability.
-KMu__0g-I3c8iV6Pk7T.name: Getting Here

subsections.description: If you are planning to arrive in Providence by train, you can find schedules and fares at amtrak.com or 1 800 USA-RAIL (1 800 872-7245). Information concerning service between Providence and Boston on the Attleboro/Stoughton line can be found at mbta.com and 800 392-6100.
subsections.title: Trains

subsections.description:
Providence is about a 15-minute cab ride from T.F. Green Airport (PVD) in Warwick, RI. You can find information on flights at pvdairport.com. Airport information: 888 268-7222; in Rhode Island: 401 737-8222.

Once you are at the airport, you can take the inexpensive T.F. Green Shuttle to your hotel.

If you are flying into Logan International Airport in Boston, MA (BOS), you can find flight information at massport.com/logan and 800 23-LOGAN. Logan is about an hour from Providence, depending on traffic.
subsections.title: Airports

subsections.description:
Peter Pan/Bonanza bus line runs daily trips to Boston, Cape Cod, Newport, Albany, New York City, and Logan and T.F. Green airports. Schedules can be found at peterpanbus.com and 401 751-8800; toll-free: 888 751-8800.

Greyhound schedules and fares can be found at greyhound.com and 800 229-9424; +1 402 330-8552 (international areas without toll-free access); 800 752-4841 (assistance for passengers with disabilities); 800 345-3109 (TDD).

For easy and inexpensive transportation within Rhode Island, including buses, trolleys and Providence/Newport ferries, consider using Rhode Island Public Transit Authority (RIPTA) at ripta.com.
subsections.title: Buses

subsections.description:
For Block Island ferry service from Point Judith and Newport, RI and New London, CT, follow this link to blockislandferry.com for complete schedules, fares and routes. Schedules vary seasonally.

For Martha’s Vineyard and Nantucket Island ferry service from Woods Hole, MA; Hyannis, MA; and New Bedford, MA, follow this link to islandferry.com. Schedules vary seasonally.
subsections.title: Ferries

-KNE-BTNEr7xN8Hq_bLc.main_description: At RISD Weekend, alumni, parents and friends join students, faculty and staff on campus for an inspiring celebration of everything that makes RISD special – the people, the studios, the conversations, the work – our creative community itself.
-KNE-BTNEr7xN8Hq_bLc.name: Reserve Your Spot

-KNE-z5qnnekrr4h_q7q.main_description: Even if you can’t physically make the trip to Providence, you can connect with other alumni and family members by logging onto the site and listening to the live-streamed Alumni Keynote and President’s Welcome. Or follow us on Twitter and tweet about your own fond memories using the hashtag #risdweekend.
-KNE-z5qnnekrr4h_q7q.name: Can’t Make It?

-KNE6IHPZfURiaM2dXrb.main_description: Support your hardworking child with RISD bucks or an excellent meal on the town. Support his or her entire class with a gift to RISD.
-KNE6IHPZfURiaM2dXrb.name: Support the Students

-KrChONKlqIBDQ40nt10.main_description:
Your registration fee for RISD Weekend covers entry to all hands-on workshops, keynote lectures and community receptions, plus admission to the RISD Museum. Your payment helps offset some of the costs associated with presenting these events.

RISD Alumni, Parents, Friends/Relatives: $25

Children (16 and younger): $10

Young Alumni (Class of 2007+): 0

RISD Faculty/Staff: Contact us to register

Additional (optional) lunch and dinner fees are based on registration dates—register early and save with our discounted rates.

Half-Century Celebration: Classes of ’72, ’67 & all earlier years: $30

Reunion Dinners: Classes of ’67, ’72, ’77, ’82, ’87, ’92, ’97, ’02, ’07
$55 if purchased by Sept. 1
$65 if purchased by Sept. 22
$85 if purchased by Oct. 1
$100 at the door
Please note that the dinner fee for children ages 6–12 is $30, under 6 is free; contact Alumni Relations at 401 709-8585 to register children under 12.

Eating with the Ecosystem: Lunch at Tillinghast Farm: $35

Full refunds may be processed until Sept. 15 and half refunds until Sept. 22. Please note there can be no refunds after Sept. 22.
-KrChONKlqIBDQ40nt10.name: Registration Fees

livestream.embed_code: <iframe id="ls_embed_1503429693" src="https://livestream.com/accounts/2814969/events/7669949/player?width=1920&height=1080&enableInfoAndActivity=true&defaultDrawer=feed&autoPlay=true&mute=false" width="1920" height="1080" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" allowfullscreen> </iframe><script type="text/javascript" data-embed_id="ls_embed_1503429693" src="https://livestream.com/assets/plugins/referrer_tracking.js"></script>
livestream.name: Livestream
livestream.subtitle: Rosanne Somerson
livestream.title: President's Update & Welcome Toast

-LNpJmwiVe8fU_UEuI8o.description: Visit Between the Clock and the Bed, curated by Jackie Gendel and Jennifer Packer, in the Memorial Hall Gallery. This group painting exhibition is comprised of artists who, regardless of aesthetics of description, take to task painting’s history of representation while incorporating individual notions of the everyday. Artists included in the exhibition are: Mike Ambron, Kristopher Benedict, Angela Dufresne, Dana Frankfort, Aaron Gilbert, Heidi Hahn, Meena Hassan, Peter Labier and Austin Lee. Plein Air and More: Sophomore Painting-a-Day in the Memorial Hall lobby showcases a selection of sophomore work based on a typical second-year assignment and features three vertically hung pieces by each sophomore in the department. Sophomore students will also be working in their studio spaces in rooms 107, 210, 211 and 307.
-LNpJmwiVe8fU_UEuI8o.name: Painting

-LNpKRFDrglEI09jv2jx.description: Photography faculty member Lindsey Beal and graduate students Lily Coleman and Dylan Everett host a cyanotype printing session in rooms 419 and 420 of the Design Center. Visitors will be able to create and take home one-of-a-kind imagery and prints made just for RISD Weekend. Faculty and students will be on hand to answer questions about the photography program.
-LNpKRFDrglEI09jv2jx.name: Photography

-LNpKaufsC7mmWAoE4Z5.description: Printmaking Department Head Cornelia McSheehy will be printing in the first-floor lithography studio and available to answer questions and speak about the process. Visit the intaglio studio to see faculty member Henry Brown MFA 15 PR working on an etching and answering questions about the technique. Students will also be working in studios throughout the building, and tours will be available.
-LNpKaufsC7mmWAoE4Z5.name: Printmaking

-LNpKm8h6lCXR0PZ-v8T.description: Visit the Sculpture department’s Metcalf studio spaces and see a range of students at work and available to answer questions about the program. Visitors are welcome to visit the metal shop and the fourth floor of Metcalf to see Sculpture majors creating work using a wide range of materials.
-LNpKm8h6lCXR0PZ-v8T.name: Sculpture

-LNpKzb9mnurx8WHq3KA.description: Watch RISD’s impressive electronic jacquard loom in action, right across from the Chace Center entrance from 10 am–2 pm. Technical Assistant Polly Spenner 10 TX will be on hand to answer questions. Current students will lead departmental tours in College Building spaces, showcasing the weaving, knit and print studios. Current students will lead departmental tours in College Building spaces from 12 – 4 pm, featuring work from
-LNpKzb9mnurx8WHq3KA.name: Textiles

-LNpL9De1XANlU7refui.description: Check out recent work by current Apparel Design students and faculty members on view throughout the building and watch spring Collection fashion shows on screens stationed on the first floor. Students will be on hand to answer questions about the department.
-LNpL9De1XANlU7refui.name: Apparel Design

-LNpLMIOrzKqxDgR_r8Q.description: Visit (RE)DEEM THE (R)EVOLUTION: The art of Saja Tourbah, on display in the first-floor BEB Gallery. Saja Tourbah MArch 14 was an exceptional artist, architect and person who died at 27 after battling cancer. This exhibition was organized by the Architecture department to celebrate her life and artistic legacy. It was curated by Karim Dada, Lina Ghotmeh and Jonathan Knowles.
-LNpLMIOrzKqxDgR_r8Q.name: Architecture

-LNpLUWm6a5lUFCs5Hyo.description: Watch Ceramics students working in the studios throwing on the wheel and sculpting by hand. See completed work on display in the installation room and display cabinet. Be sure to visit the glaze lab and kiln room to see how the materials that make up the pieces are formulated and then fired in a range of kiln types.
-LNpLUWm6a5lUFCs5Hyo.name: Ceramics

-LNpLc_iLmqyHBmFjIB_.description: Join current FAV students for a look at the inner workings of the department. They will be showing some incredible work and explaining how they made it happen. Demos on techniques and advances like digital compositing, lighting, green screen, 2D animation techniques and 3D Maya rendering will be ongoing.
-LNpLc_iLmqyHBmFjIB_.name: Film/Animation/Video

-LNpLzrgf0nEQO3PZDKy.description: Students will be working and available to answer questions in the Wood Shop at Metcalf and in studio spaces in the Bank Building. Drawings will be on display in Prov-Wash. A variety of demos will be held during the open studio.
-LNpLzrgf0nEQO3PZDKy.name: Furniture Design

-LNpM5gqOcr0geLzcaP-.description: Visit the Hot Shop to see students blowing glass. They’ll be happy to answer your questions about the process.
-LNpM5gqOcr0geLzcaP-.name: Glass

-LNpMGoP89eCFej_xA0X.description: Please join us in the Graphic Design Commons between 1 and 4 pm for a special celebration honoring retiring professor Tom Ockerse, who taught in the department for 47 years. Then head up the hill to the Woods-Gerry Gallery, where the Graphic Design Department Exhibition featuring work by current students is on view. Students will also be working in the studio and are happy to discuss their work and the department with you.
-LNpMGoP89eCFej_xA0X.name: Graphic Design

-LNpMPuR3Bgs0R9FBJ7n.description: Alumnus and celebrated children’s book creator David Wiesner 78 IL will discuss his process and sources of inspiration in a 1 pm artist talk in the first-floor ISB Gallery, where his work is on view in David Wiesner: Journeys in Visual Storytelling. Visit our Paper Gallery on the fourth floor for Telling Stories, an exhibition curated by Senior Critic Mary Jane Begin 85 IL showcasing work produced by students in relation to summer internships. Students will also be working in studios and available to answer questions about the department.
-LNpMPuR3Bgs0R9FBJ7n.name: Illustration

-LNpMbFOrS12Bx7Y5MGY.description: Industrial Design Society of America, RISD chapter, hosts Power of Play: Making Adventure, an all-day make-a-thon (10 am–8 pm) exploring ways to incorporate risk and unstructured play into the practice of making. Stop in to engage with students and see the creative process in action. Industrial Design majors will be on hand to assist visitors and answer any questions.
-LNpMbFOrS12Bx7Y5MGY.name: Industrial Design

-LNpMnAR-41fTjpTlbph.description: Visit the Interior Architecture department studios to see student work and learn about the department.
-LNpMnAR-41fTjpTlbph.name: Interior Architecture

-LNpN-2bm-o0rkRdrXzV.description: Visit the Landscape Architecture department for an exhibition of current work and research underway on the second floor of BEB. See models, drawings and fabrications that visualize experiential site phenomena and cultural landscapes as well as research addressing the issues and vulnerabilities of coastal communities with projections of rising seas and extreme weather. Students will be in studio to answer questions, showcase work and lead tours.
-LNpN-2bm-o0rkRdrXzV.name: Landscape Architecture

-LNpNBuu2tzT7_xQXulZ.description: Check out student work in progress as well as finished jewelry in exhibition cases. A looping PowerPoint presentation in room 216 will demonstrate how objects are created using digital technology. J+M students will be working in the studio and are happy to discuss their work and the department with you.
-LNpNBuu2tzT7_xQXulZ.name: Jewelry + Metalsmithing

transitionpage.description:
During RISD Weekend, alumni, parents, students and friends meet on campus for an inspiring celebration of everything that makes RISD extraordinary—the people, the studios, the discourse, the work.

Over two and a half days, RISD Weekend features a special mix of exhibitions, panels, talks, tours and demonstrations—along with plenty of other opportunities to engage with the campus and its incredible mix of artists and designers. Registration opens on June 17.
transitionpage.name: Save the date
